net.cloud.gfx.elements

Class TextField.DisplayableText

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.gfx.elements.TextField.DisplayableText
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PasswordField.DisplayablePasswordText
    Enclosing class:
    TextField

    class TextField.DisplayableText
extends java.lang.Object
    String wrapper with the added functionality of keeping track of which substring indices are bounding the displayable text. For keeping track of how much and what to show.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String displayed
      The String containing text that should be in view
      protected boolean hintLeft
      True if the text should be sized left to right (false for right-to-left)
      protected int leftIdx
      The left inclusive bound
      protected int rightIdx
      The right exclusive bound

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisplayableText()
      Create new displayable text on the premise the text field starts blank

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void determineLeftwise(java.awt.FontMetrics metrics)
      Update the display by maintaining the left index and showing as much text as possible moving left to right.
      protected void determineRightwise(java.awt.FontMetrics metrics)
      Update the display by maintaining the right index and showing as much text as possible moving right to left.
      protected void displayAll()
      Set the field members to display all of the text currently in the field
      protected java.lang.String getDisplayed() 
      protected void reset()
      Reset all field members back to default, as if there is no text to display.
      protected void setFields(java.lang.String text, int leftIdx, int rightIdx)
      Set all of the fields for displayed text.
      protected void updateDisplay(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
      Figure out what text should be displayed.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public DisplayableText()

    • Method Detail

      • updateDisplay

        protected void updateDisplay(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Figure out what text should be displayed. Upon completion, the displayText will have its text and indices changed to reflect what should currently be drawn into the field.
        Parameters:
        g2d - The graphics object currently being used for drawing

      • determineRightwise

        protected void determineRightwise(java.awt.FontMetrics metrics)
        Update the display by maintaining the right index and showing as much text as possible moving right to left. The display field members are changed, the glyph vector is not invalidated.
        Parameters:
        metrics - A FontMetrics object to measure text with

      • determineLeftwise

        protected void determineLeftwise(java.awt.FontMetrics metrics)
        Update the display by maintaining the left index and showing as much text as possible moving left to right. The display field members are changed, the glyph vector is not invalidated.
        Parameters:
        metrics - A FontMetrics object to measure text with

      • displayAll

        protected void displayAll()
        Set the field members to display all of the text currently in the field

      • reset

        protected void reset()
        Reset all field members back to default, as if there is no text to display.

      • getDisplayed

        protected java.lang.String getDisplayed()
        Returns:
        The text currently in view

      • setFields

        protected void setFields(java.lang.String text,
                         int leftIdx,
                         int rightIdx)
        Set all of the fields for displayed text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text being shown
        leftIdx - The left index, inclusive
        rightIdx - The right index, exclusive
